top_risks.title: Claims team using public AI tools
top_risks.description: Detected 3 high-risk AI events from the Claims department. This department handles sensitive data that should not be processed by external AI systems.
top_risks.suggested_next_step: Immediately review Claims team's AI usage policies and provide approved alternatives.

top_risks.title: Unknown AI tools in use with no governance
top_risks.description: Found 2 events using unidentified AI services. These tools are outside IT visibility and may pose compliance risks.
top_risks.suggested_next_step: Conduct an AI tool inventory and establish an approved vendor list.

top_risks.title: Significant data being sent to AI providers
top_risks.description: Detected 5 events with large data transfers (>4KB). This may indicate employees uploading documents or sensitive information.
top_risks.suggested_next_step: Implement DLP controls and train employees on data handling policies.

shadow_ai_profile: Most AI usage is in Engineering (21%) and Claims (21%). About 100.0% of all AI events go to unsanctioned or unknown AI tools.
